byline.contributor: Rukmini Callimachi contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Sec of State John Kerry classifies Islamic State's atrocities against Christians, Yazidis and Shiite Muslims as genocide; determination made at request of Congress and to appease numerous religious and human rights groups carries symbolic significance but is not expected to alter policy.

headline.print_headline: Kerry Says Attacks by ISIS on Christians, Yazidis and Shiites Are Genocide
headline.main: Citing Atrocities, John Kerry Calls ISIS Actions Genocide

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The secretary of state’s declaration, made in response to a congressional deadline, is unlikely to change American policy.
lead_paragraph: The secretary of state’s declaration, made in response to a congressional deadline, is unlikely to change American policy.
